paper_abstract: We enumerate bijectively the family of involutive Baxter permutations according to various parameters; in particular we obtain an elementary proof that the number of involutive Baxter permutations of size 2n with no fixed points is 3.2(n-1)/(n+1)(n+2) ((2n)(n)), a formula originally discovered by M. Bousquet-Melou using generating functions. The same coefficient also enumerates planar maps with n edges, endowed with an acyclic orientation having a unique source, and such that the source and sinks are all incident to the outer face.
paper_title: Bijective Counting of Involutive Baxter Permutations
